snippet: Philippine officials are examining potential legal violations and fines against the United States after a $277 million ship ran aground in a protected coral reef.
abstract: United States Navy has decided to scrap $277 million minesweeper that struck protected reef near Philippines, while Philippine officials examine potential legal violations and fines to be levied against United States.
lead_paragraph: Philippine officials are examining potential legal violations and fines against the United States after a $277 million ship ran aground in a protected coral reef.

headline.seo: U.S. Navy to Scrap Vessel Stuck on Philippine Reef
headline.main: U.S. Navy to Scrap Vessel Stuck on Philippine Reef
headline.print_headline: The Philippines: U.S. Navy to Dismantle Stranded Ship
